turns.speaker: CRASH
turns.text: You got a Hall of Fame arm but you're pissing it away.

turns.speaker: NUKE
turns.text: I ain't pissing nothing away--I got a Porsche already.  A 944 with A.C. and a quadraphonic Blaupunkt.

turns.speaker: CRASH
turns.text: You don't need a quadraphonic Blaupunkt--you need a curve ball.  In the Show, everybody can hit the fastball.

turns.speaker: NUKE
turns.text: You been in the Majors?

turns.speaker: CRASH
turns.text: Yep.

turns.speaker: CRASH
turns.text: You could be one of those guys-- but you don't give a fuck, Meat.

turns.speaker: NUKE
turns.text: God damn it I'm sick of you calling me "Meat"!  You wanta step outside!

turns.speaker: NUKE
turns.text: This is from Tony for the rainout. C'mon, man, let's go to the party.

turns.speaker: CRASH
turns.text: Naw...

turns.speaker: NUKE
turns.text: "Naw"?  There's ice skaters coming! You ever made love to an ice skater?

turns.speaker: CRASH
turns.text: By the dozen.  Holiday on Ice, Ice Capades, Ice Follies--  I'm through with one night stands.

turns.speaker: NUKE
turns.text: You're through with one night stands?!  What do you want?

turns.speaker: CRASH
turns.text: I just wanta play everyday despite small nagging injuries--and go home to a woman who appreciates how full of crap I truly am.

turns.speaker: NUKE
turns.text: You're weird, man--I want a ice skater real bad.

turns.speaker: CRASH
turns.text: Go for it.

turns.speaker: NUKE
turns.text: If I get laid, you won't tell Annie?

turns.speaker: CRASH
turns.text: I won't have to.

turns.speaker: CRASH
turns.text: Party without me.

turns.speaker: NUKE
turns.text: God--what a Big League move.

turns.speaker: NUKE
turns.text: Can I ask you something?

turns.speaker: CRASH
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: NUKE
turns.text: What would you think of a pitcher who wore women's panties?

turns.speaker: CRASH
turns.text: If he had a good breaking ball, I'd respect the shit outta him.

turns.speaker: NUKE
turns.text: I was playing naked.

turns.speaker: CRASH
turns.text: I know, I know--I have that dream all the time.  We're almost home.

turns.speaker: NUKE
turns.text: Annie says her panties will keep one side of my brain occupied while I'm on the mound, thus keeping my brain slightly off center, which is where it should be for artists and pitchers.  She also said I should throw whatever pitches you call for.

turns.speaker: CRASH
turns.text: Annie's a smart lady.

turns.speaker: NUKE
turns.text: I was great, eh?

turns.speaker: CRASH
turns.text: Your fastball was up and your curveball was hanging--in the Show they woulda ripped you.

turns.speaker: NUKE
turns.text: Can't you let me enjoy the moment?

turns.speaker: CRASH
turns.text: The moment's over.  If this guy starts me off with a breaking ball, I'm going downtown--

turns.speaker: NUKE
turns.text: Hey, I'm cruisin', man--what're you doing out here?!

turns.speaker: CRASH
turns.text: I want you to throw this one at the bat rack.

turns.speaker: NUKE
turns.text: Why?!  I'm finally throwin' the damn thing where I want to.

turns.speaker: CRASH
turns.text: It'll keep the fear of God in the hitters.  Trust me.

turns.speaker: NUKE
turns.text: You're the boss.

turns.speaker: NUKE
turns.text: You told him I was throwing a deuce, right?

turns.speaker: CRASH
turns.text: Yep.  He really crushed that dinger, didn't he.  Musta gone 450 feet...damn...

turns.speaker: NUKE
turns.text: I love winning, Crash, you hear me?  I love It.  Teach me everything.

turns.speaker: CRASH
turns.text: It's time you started working on your interviews.

turns.speaker: NUKE
turns.text: What do I gotta do?

turns.speaker: CRASH
turns.text: Learn your cliches.  Study them. Know them.  They're your friends.

turns.speaker: CRASH
turns.text: Write this down.  "We gotta play 'em one day at a time."

turns.speaker: NUKE
turns.text: Boring.

turns.speaker: CRASH
turns.text: Of course.  That's the point.  "I'm just happy to be here and hope I can help the ballclub."

turns.speaker: NUKE
turns.text: Jesus.

turns.speaker: CRASH
turns.text: Write, write--"I just wanta give It my best shot and, Good Lord willing, things'll work out."

turns.speaker: NUKE
turns.text: "...Good Lord willing, things'll work out."

turns.speaker: CRASH
turns.text: Yep.  So how's Annie?

turns.speaker: NUKE
turns.text: She's getting steamed 'cause I'm still re-channeling my sexual energy--maybe I should cave in and sleep with her once just to calm her down.  What'ya think?

turns.speaker: CRASH
turns.text: You outta your mind?  If you give in now you might start losing.  Never fuck with a winning streak.

turns.speaker: CRASH
turns.text: What's wrong?

turns.speaker: NUKE
turns.text: I'm nervous--my old man's here.

turns.speaker: CRASH
turns.text: Anybody says anything bad about Millie, I'll break his neck.

turns.speaker: NUKE
turns.text: Hey, guys, I got a game to pitch.

turns.speaker: NUKE
turns.text: Club's expanding its roster to finish the season--

turns.speaker: CRASH
turns.text: Shut up.  I'm playing.  Oh you won't regret it, young girls don't forget it, lost in their own wilderness ...  But it's all so easy--Just try a little tenderness...

turns.speaker: NUKE
turns.text: I'm going to the Show.

turns.speaker: CRASH
turns.text: Then go.

turns.speaker: NUKE
turns.text: I'm trying to thank you.

turns.speaker: CRASH
turns.text: Let go of me!

turns.speaker: NUKE
turns.text: Settle what?

turns.speaker: CRASH
turns.text: C ' mon!

turns.speaker: NUKE
turns.text: I don't wanta fight you, I wanta thank you.  Let's have a drink and forget this--

turns.speaker: CRASH
turns.text: God damn it, you fucking virgin prick--step outside.

turns.speaker: NUKE
turns.text: C'mon, we got nothin' to fight about.

turns.speaker: CRASH
turns.text: You fuck!

turns.speaker: NUKE
turns.text: Why am I a fuck?

turns.speaker: CRASH
turns.text: Why are you a fuck?  'Cause you got talent.  I got brains.  But you got talent! You're God damn left arm is worth a million dollars a year.  All my limbs put together are worth 7 cents a pound--and that's for science and dog meat.

turns.speaker: NUKE
turns.text: You're a great catcher.

turns.speaker: CRASH
turns.text: Come over here into the light so I can kick your ass.

turns.speaker: NUKE
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: CRASH
turns.text: Okay, I'll kick your ass there.

turns.speaker: NUKE
turns.text: I'll take you back to the hotel.

turns.speaker: CRASH
turns.text: You know what the difference Is between hitting .250 and hitting .300?  1 got it figured out.  Twenty-five hits a year in 500 at bats is 50 points.  Okay?  There's 6 months in a season, that's about 25 weeks--you get one extra flare a week--just one--a gork, a ground ball with eyes, a dying quail-- just one more dying quail a week and you're in Yankee Stadium!

turns.speaker: CRASH
turns.text: Nuke...tell me something.  Did you hit me with your right or your left?

turns.speaker: NUKE
turns.text: My right.

turns.speaker: CRASH
turns.text: Good.  Good.  That's terrific...

turns.speaker: NUKE
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: CRASH
turns.text: If ya get in a fight with some asshole, never hit his with your pitching hand.  ya might get injured.  That's another lesson for ya--now quit fucking around and help me up.

turns.speaker: CRASH
turns.text: Sorry about last night.

turns.speaker: NUKE
turns.text: Forget it.

turns.speaker: CRASH
turns.text: I have been known, on occasion, to howl at the moon.  D'you understand that?

turns.speaker: NUKE
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: CRASH
turns.text: You will.  Look, Nuke--these Big League hitters are gonna light you up like a pin ball machine for awhile-- don't worry about it.  Be cocky and arrogant even when you're getting beat.  That's the secret.  You gotta play this game with fear and arrogance.

turns.speaker: NUKE
turns.text: Fear and ignorance.

turns.speaker: CRASH
turns.text: No.  Fear and arrogance, you, hayseed, not ignorance!

turns.speaker: NUKE
turns.text: I know.  I just like to see you get all worked up.

turns.speaker: NUKE
turns.text: Well, I got Annie all warmed up for ya...  She's just waiting for you to show up, y'know...

turns.speaker: CRASH
turns.text: I don't need a crazy woman in my life.

turns.speaker: NUKE
turns.text: Maybe you do.  Y'know I'm starting to like this game--baseball's a helluva good way to make a living.

turns.speaker: CRASH
turns.text: It's the best, Nuke...the absolute fucking best.

turns.speaker: NUKE
turns.text: Yeah, thanks for everything.

turns.speaker: CRASH
turns.text: Nuke--  Good luck.

turns.speaker: NUKE
turns.text: You too...Meat.

turns.speaker: SKIP
turns.text: Crash Davis?

turns.speaker: CRASH
turns.text: The Crash Davis. ) And you, Larry Hockett, should recognize me 'cause five years ago in the Texas League when you were pitching for El Paso and I was hitting cleanup for Shreveport, you hung a curve on an 0-2 pitch of a 3-2 game in bottom of the 8th and I tattooed it over the Goodyear Tire sign, beat you 4-3-- and I got a free wheel alignment from Goodyear.

turns.speaker: CRASH
turns.text: I'm too old for this shit.  Why the hell am I back in "A" ball?

turns.speaker: SKIP
turns.text: 'Cause of Ebby Calvin LaLoosh.  The Big Club's got a hundred grand in him-

turns.speaker: SKIP
turns.text: We want you to room with him on the road and stay on his case all year.  He can go all the way.

turns.speaker: CRASH
turns.text: And where can I go?

turns.speaker: SKIP
turns.text: You can keep going to the ballpark and keep gettin' paid to do it.  Beats hell outta working at Sears.

turns.speaker: CRASH
turns.text: I don't know.  I haven't caught anything yet.

turns.speaker: SKIP
turns.text: What're you thinking about out here, Nuke?

turns.speaker: CRASH
turns.text: Yeah, Skip, you wanted to see me?

turns.speaker: SKIP
turns.text: Crash, shut the door.

turns.speaker: EBBY
turns.text: Step outside, pal.

turns.speaker: CRASH
turns.text: Love to--

turns.speaker: CRASH
turns.text: I don't believe in fighting.

turns.speaker: EBBY
turns.text: Pussy.

turns.speaker: CRASH
turns.text: Take the first shot at me.

turns.speaker: EBBY
turns.text: I ain't hitting a man first.

turns.speaker: CRASH
turns.text: Hit me in the chest with this...

turns.speaker: EBBY
turns.text: I'd kill ya.

turns.speaker: CRASH
turns.text: From what I hear you couldn't hit a bull in the ass with a slingshot

turns.speaker: EBBY
turns.text: Don't try me.

turns.speaker: CRASH
turns.text: Throw it.  C'mon, right in the chest.

turns.speaker: EBBY
turns.text: No way.

turns.speaker: CRASH
turns.text: C'mon, Meat.  You can't hit me 'cause you're starting to think about it already, you're starting to think how embarrassing it'll be to miss, how all these people would laugh.  C'mon, Rook--show me that million dollar arm 'cause I'm getting a good idea about the five cent head--

turns.speaker: EBBY
turns.text: We fight, she gets the clown-- how's that happen?

turns.speaker: CRASH
turns.text: Shut up--I like this song...  April in Paris, this is a feeling, No one can ever reprieve...

turns.speaker: EBBY
turns.text: She's playing with my mind.

turns.speaker: CRASH
turns.text: It's a damn easy thing to play with.

turns.speaker: EBBY
turns.text: Who you calling a "boy"?

turns.speaker: CRASH
turns.text: See ya at the yard, Meat.

turns.speaker: NUKE
turns.text: I gotta go now, Dad.

turns.speaker: FATHER
turns.text: I was thinking I could fly up and spend a week in the Big Leagues with you--help you get comfortable.

turns.speaker: NUKE
turns.text: No.  If I screw up, I wanta do it alone.  I'll call.

turns.speaker: FATHER
turns.text: We'll be praying for you.

turns.speaker: NUKE
turns.text: Dad--if my curveball is hanging, God ain't gonna help me.

turns.speaker: FATHER
turns.text: We'll pray anyway.

turns.speaker: NUKE
turns.text: If it makes you and mom feel better, go for it.  I gotta run--

turns.speaker: MILLIE
turns.text: Hi, Jimmy.  Want a ride?

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: Have you accepted Jesus Christ as your personal savior?

turns.speaker: MILLIE
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: Can I give you my testimony?

turns.speaker: MILLIE
turns.text: You can do anything you want.  Hop in.

turns.speaker: MILLIE
turns.text: Well tell 'em, honey.

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: We're getting married.

turns.speaker: SKIP
turns.text: Where's Ebby?

turns.speaker: LARRY
turns.text: Ain't he warning up?

turns.speaker: SKIP
turns.text: No.  The guy's professional debut and he forgets about it.

turns.speaker: LARRY
turns.text: Better find our bonus baby, eh?

turns.speaker: SKIP
turns.text: Little high.

turns.speaker: LARRY
turns.text: C'mon big 'un, you're okay...

turns.speaker: SKIP
turns.text: He walked eighteen?!

turns.speaker: LARRY
turns.text: It's a league record.

turns.speaker: SKIP
turns.text: Struck out eighteen...

turns.speaker: LARRY
turns.text: League record.  And he hit the Radio Announcer, a Sportswriter, and the Bull Mascot twice--also league records--  Joe, the guy's got some serious shit.

turns.speaker: LARRY
turns.text: Ohyeah.  I shoulda throwed a slider.  Damn, Crash, how're ya?

turns.speaker: SKIP
turns.text: I'm Joe Riggins.  Sit down

turns.speaker: LARRY
turns.text: He's got a million dollar arm and a five cent head.

turns.speaker: SKIP
turns.text: --we had the gun on him tonight-- the last five pitches he threw were faster than the first five. 96 miles an hour, 98, 97, 97. 97.   He's got the best young arm I've seen in 30 years.

turns.speaker: LARRY
turns.text: But he ain't quite sure which plane he's on, y'know what I mean...

turns.speaker: SKIP
turns.text: You been around, you're smart, you're professional, you know what it takes--  We want you to mature the kid.

turns.speaker: LARRY
turns.text: Sears sucks, Crash, I tried it once.  Sold Lady Kenmores--it's nasty, nasty work.

turns.speaker: SKIP
turns.text: Even if it's the Carolina League-- this is a chance to play everyday.

turns.speaker: SKIP
turns.text: You guys lollygag the ball around the infield, ya lollygag you're- way to first, ya lollygag in an' outta the dugout.  You know what that makes ya  Lollygaggers.  What's our record, Larry?

turns.speaker: LARRY
turns.text: We're eight and sixteen.

turns.speaker: SKIP
turns.text: Eight and sixteen?!  How'd we ever win eight?  Jose, what's this sign?

turns.speaker: LARRY
turns.text: Eight and twenty-four.

turns.speaker: SKIP
turns.text: Eight and twenty-four!  How'd we ever win 8 games?

turns.speaker: LARRY
turns.text: It's a miracle.

turns.speaker: SKIP
turns.text: Look, guys--I'm a man, I got needs too.  I understand this party-- but...  sex is the one thing you can get further behind in and catch up faster than anything I know.  There's a baseball lesson in there somewhere.  Where's Crash?

turns.speaker: SKIP
turns.text: Patkin was a tribute to baseball...

turns.speaker: LARRY
turns.text: ...and one helluva guy.

turns.speaker: SKIP
turns.text: Jesus--what's got into Nuke?

turns.speaker: LARRY
turns.text: I heard he's wearing women's underwear--and he's breathing through his pingala nostril.

turns.speaker: SKIP
turns.text: I'm getting too old for this game.

turns.speaker: SKIP
turns.text: Nuke's overthrowing tonight, he don't look loose.  Anything bothering him?

turns.speaker: LARRY
turns.text: He said his chakras were jammed and he was breathing out of the wrong nostril.

turns.speaker: SKIP
turns.text: Okay...

turns.speaker: SKIP
turns.text: What the hell's going on out there?

turns.speaker: LARRY
turns.text: It's a damn convention.

turns.speaker: SKIP
turns.text: Check it out.

turns.speaker: SKIP
turns.text: The organization wants to make a change...now that Nuke's gone they wanta bring up some young catcher...

turns.speaker: LARRY
turns.text: Some kid hittin' .300 in Lynchburg ...probably a bust.

turns.speaker: SKIP
turns.text: I put in a word for you with the organization--told 'em I thought you'd make a fine minor league manager someday...Might be an opening at Salem next year--

turns.speaker: SANDY
turns.text: What'you want, kid?

turns.speaker: NUKE
turns.text: Jim looking for somebody.

turns.speaker: SANDY
turns.text: Who ain't?

turns.speaker: NUKE
turns.text: Looking for Crash Davis.

turns.speaker: SANDY
turns.text: Ain't here.

turns.speaker: NUKE
turns.text: I'm Nuke LaLoosh.  With the Bulls.

turns.speaker: SANDY
turns.text: Your breaking ball's getting better but ya need a change up.

turns.speaker: TONY
turns.text: Crash ain't there.  He never gets back till four or five--

turns.speaker: NUKE
turns.text: Where does he go?

turns.speaker: TONY
turns.text: Well, I'd rather not say.

turns.speaker: NUKE
turns.text: They called me up to the Show and I wanta tell Crash goodbye.

turns.speaker: TONY
turns.text: Goddamn, that's great!  Jesus!  Listen, Crash don't like anybody to know it but--  Most nights he goes down to, you know, down to Niggertown.  To Sandy's...  the whorehouse.

turns.speaker: NUKE
turns.text: He goes to a whorehouse every night?

turns.speaker: TONY
turns.text: Don't tell him I told you--he'd break my neck.

turns.speaker: GREEN
turns.text: Thank you.

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: ...he did what he was told.

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: I mean, the guy is history as far as I'm concerned. History.

turns.speaker: GREEN
turns.text: But you can't just fire him. Webb's his brother-in-law. He's County Commissioner.

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: So what? Everybody out here with cowboy boots is a fuckin' county commissioner or related to a county commissioner. I'm fuckin' sick of it.

turns.speaker: GREEN
turns.text: This is his state. His uncle's Chief Judge. His brother-in-law runs the County Commission. I don't know how many other relatives he's got in town.  There's gotta be a way to work him back in.

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: Phil, I can understand. You're in the finances, you're upstairs, but you are not on the floor. I got thousands of players. I got five hundred dealers.  They're all lookin' to rob me blind, twenty-four hours a day. I have to let them know I'm watching all the details, all the time; that there is not one single thing I will not catch as I am over here.

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: Look at yours.

turns.speaker: GREEN
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: Look at that. Look at this. There's nothin'... look how many blueberries your muffin has and how many mine has. Yours is falling apart. I have nothing.

turns.speaker: GREEN
turns.text: What are you talking about?

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: It's like everything else in this place. You don't do it yourself, it never gets done.

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: ...was gonna stop what came up next at the casino.

turns.speaker: GREEN
turns.text: I can't believe you're doing this.

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: It turned out Phil Green, Mr Integrity, had a partner nobody knew about... and when she showed up and started demanding some money from the Tangiers...

turns.speaker: GREEN
turns.text: Why are you doing this to me?

turns.speaker: GREEN
turns.text: I'm a little in shock, quite frankly...

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: Now, instead of the cops only lookin' at Nicky, they started looking at Green too. And he was supposed to be our squeaky...

turns.speaker: SENATOR
turns.text: Hi, Ace.

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: Hello, Senator.

turns.speaker: SENATOR
turns.text: Hey, I need a room. Need a room.

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: Good to see ya.  William would you...

turns.speaker: SENATOR
turns.text: I was never - I was never your guest at the Tangiers.

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: You were never my guest?!

turns.speaker: SENATOR
turns.text: That's right.

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: I never comped you?! I don't comp you at least two or three times a month at the Tangiers?!

turns.speaker: SENATOR
turns.text: Uh, I - I'd... I'd like to answer - answer that at this time.

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: Liar.

turns.speaker: SENATOR
turns.text: Mr Rothstein is being very typical to this point.

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: He's lying.

turns.speaker: SENATOR
turns.text: The only time I was at the Tangiers was when I had dinner with Barney Greenstein.

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: Was I at that dinner? Just tell me -

turns.speaker: SENATOR
turns.text: You were wandering around.

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: Was I at that dinner?

turns.speaker: SENATOR
turns.text: You were wandering around.

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: Was I at that dinner?

turns.speaker: SENATOR
turns.text: You were wandering around.

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: Was I at that dinner?

turns.speaker: SENATOR
turns.text: You were in the m- You were in the building.

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: I was in the building!

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: You know damn well I was at that dinner, and you swore to me that I would have a fair hearing at that dinner! Did you not?! Did you not?!  Well, tell me I was at least at the dinner! A-allow me that much.  Give me that much at least!

turns.speaker: SENATOR
turns.text: Yes, you were.

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: As far as the world was concerned Andy Stone, the head of the Teamsters' Pension Fund, was a legitimate guy.

turns.speaker: STONE
turns.text: This is a very auspicious occasion.

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: A powerful man.

turns.speaker: STONE
turns.text: Philip, if you would rise.

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: He even played golf with the President.

turns.speaker: STONE
turns.text: On behalf of the Teamsters' Pension Fund, it is my pleasure to present to you . . .

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: But Andy also took orders. And when he was told to give a pension fund loan to Philip Green...

turns.speaker: STONE
turns.text: ...this check for $62,700,000 for the new Tangiers.

turns.speaker: STONE
turns.text: You don't have to have a license to work in a casino. All you gotta do is apply for one. The state law says you can work in a casino while they're processing your application. They got a ten-year backlog.

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: But what happens when they do find out?

turns.speaker: STONE
turns.text: Why would they want to find out? We're puttin' a hundred million into this desert here. Why would they want to lock us out?  And besides, they'll never find out. All you gotta do is keep changing your job title. Like, uh, from Casino Executive to Food and Beverage Chairman. And what happens it, they take your application, they put it at the bottom of the pile. I know guys workin' there for thirty years, don't have a license.

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: It's a tough proposition, Andy. You, you know, if I did it, I'd have to run it my way.

turns.speaker: STONE
turns.text: You got it.

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: I'm serious. No interference.

turns.speaker: STONE
turns.text: Nobody's gonna interfere with your running the casino. I guarantee it.

turns.speaker: STONE
turns.text: He's on all night, screamin' about how he's gonna take his damn lawsuit all the way to the Supreme Court. He really must be crazy. He's gonna go to Washington with this?  He's out of his fuckin' mind.

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: It's a pity in this...

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: First of all, what they did was totally unconstitutional. We're already on the list to be heard before the Supreme Court of the United States later this year.

turns.speaker: STONE
turns.text: These guys back home don't give a fuck about the Supreme Court and any of this bullshit! They want things to quiet down. They want you to walk away from -

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: Walk away? Andy, you can't be serious. How can I walk away? Don't you see what's goin' on here? Don't you see what's at stake?

turns.speaker: STONE
turns.text: The old man said, 'Maybe your friend should give in.'  And when the old man says 'maybe', that's like a papal bull. Not only should you quit, you should run!

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: Know what my problem is? Every time they mention my name in the papers, these cocksuckers, they mention Nicky, too. How the fuck does that help?  I mean, the heat he brought down is murder!  We had a police department who was cooperative. He's pissed them off so much now that nobody can make a move anymore. I mean, what do you do about that?

turns.speaker: STONE
turns.text: What do you propose?

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: I don't know, he doesn't listen to me. Maybe he should...  get lost for a while. Take a vacation. Would that be so bad?

turns.speaker: STONE
turns.text: They ain't sendin' Nicky nowhere.

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: All right, look, if he took a break, it would just give everybody some time to maneuver. That's all I'm saying. It's all that I'm saying.

turns.speaker: STONE
turns.text: I would forget about the maneuver. I would just get out.

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: I can't do that.

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: Even after a little vacation, they hassled him at the airport.

turns.speaker: COP #1
turns.text: Excuse me.

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: I mean, Frank Marino was there to meet him, but so were the cops. This time they wanted to pinch him for some diamond burglary in Antwerp.

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: ...stupid things.

turns.speaker: COP #1
turns.text: Watch it, partner, watch it!

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: The worst was Blue.

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: ...been right, but who knows?

turns.speaker: COP #1
turns.text: Jesus Christ! What gun? He's got a fuckin' hero sandwich here.

turns.speaker: COP #1
turns.text: No, you're not calm.

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: ...I will let her in the house for five minutes if you gentlemen will escort her out if she happens not to want to leave. Because I don't - I -

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: Yeah, I don't want her in there more than a few more minutes.

turns.speaker: COP #1
turns.text: No, it's - it'll just be a couple of minutes. We got other things to do too, you know. He'll hurry her up. How's everything else besides this?

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: Fine, fine. How's your family?

turns.speaker: COP #1
turns.text: Not bad, not bad. In fact, uh, my wife's pregnant again.

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: Oh, good.

turns.speaker: COP #1
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: Congratulations.

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: Okay, Randy. Thank you.

turns.speaker: COP #1
turns.text: All right, take care.

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: Stop -

turns.speaker: COP #1
turns.text: Wait, hold on a second.

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: Hey!

turns.speaker: COP #1
turns.text: Hold on a second.

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: Look, look. You can't stop her for speeding? I mean, look what the hell she's doing.

turns.speaker: COP #1
turns.text: Speeding?

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: But one thing I could never understand, was that she could have everything under control, except for her old pimp boyfriend, Lester Diamond.

turns.speaker: LESTER
turns.text: Look, Gin, you know I got other people in this. I got partners. But I want you to understand that I am lookin' out for you in this thing.  Okay? You're going to get yours back... and you're gonna get it back first. Okay?

turns.speaker: LESTER
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: He was a moocher, a card cheat, a country-club golf hustler. A scumbag... chasing dentists for a few bucks.

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: She's my wife.  Look at me. You did know that, didn't you? You knew that she's my wife? Huh? Hey, look at me.

turns.speaker: LESTER
turns.text: Yeah, yeah. I know that.

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: You do? Yeah? Well, if you ever come back again... ever... to take her money... next time bring a pistol. That way you got a chance. Be a man, don't be a fuckin' pimp. Now, you want to do me a favor? Get out of here. I want to be alone with my wife. Get the fuck up and get out of here.

turns.speaker: LESTER
turns.text: Okay.

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: You fuckin' piece of shit.

turns.speaker: LESTER
turns.text: Hey, that's just fuckin' - That's bullshit. You know, you know, what the fuck?

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: M- Uh, Mr. and Mrs. Rothstein?

turns.speaker: LESTER
turns.text: Hey, little Dale Evans.

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: Hello.

turns.speaker: LESTER
turns.text: Hello.

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: Yeah, is this Lester? This is Sam...

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: ...Rothstein. I want to talk to Ginger. Put her on the phone.

turns.speaker: LESTER
turns.text: She's not here, Sam.

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: Lester...

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: ...listen to me very carefully. I want to talk to Ginger. I want my kid back. I want her put on a plane immediately.

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: I know she's there. Don't fuck around with me.

turns.speaker: LESTER
turns.text: Uh, I'm not. Sam, I wouldn't...

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: You understand? Put her on the fuckin' phone.

turns.speaker: LESTER
turns.text: Sam, I - I don't know where she is, okay?

turns.speaker: LESTER
turns.text: So, l-l-l-listen, I te- I te- I tell you - can I call you back in a few minutes?

turns.speaker: LESTER
turns.text: Mm-hm.  1862. Okay, good. I'll call you right b-

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: Right away.

turns.speaker: LESTER
turns.text: I'll call you right back.

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: Right back.

turns.speaker: LESTER
turns.text: You got it.  Schmuck.  All right. I just bought us a few minutes. Want to get back at this prick?

turns.speaker: BANKER
turns.text: Now this is just a signature card.

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: So, once she signs those papers, she'll be the only person to have total access to the box?  No one else, including myself?

turns.speaker: BANKER
turns.text: That's right.

turns.speaker: BANKER
turns.text: Sam, let me ask you a question. You must really trust your wife.

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: Yeah, sure I do. Why?

turns.speaker: BANKER
turns.text: No, tha-that's good. It's just unusual. To tell you the truth, so many of my clients don't.

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: Well...

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: Oh. Have a good day at school.

turns.speaker: AMY
turns.text: Okay.

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: Hello? Hello! Ginger.

turns.speaker: AMY
turns.text: Help, Daddy!

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: Amy! Amy, open the door!

turns.speaker: AMY
turns.text: I can't! I'm tied!

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: Wh-wh -

turns.speaker: AMY
turns.text: Dad!

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: What happened? What happened? Who did this to you?

turns.speaker: AMY
turns.text: Mommy.

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: I'm gonna get a knife and cut you loose, honey, I'll -

turns.speaker: AMY
turns.text: Oh, no, please, please.

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: When did this happen, honey?

turns.speaker: AMY
turns.text: I don't know.

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: You don't know? What time did your mother do this? When did she leave?

turns.speaker: AMY
turns.text: I don't know.

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: Ohhh...

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: ...by the only kind of guys that can actually get you that kind of money: sixty-two million, seven-hundred thousand dollars. I don't know all the details.

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: Matter of fact...

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: But it's in the desert where lots of the town's problems are solved.

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: Got a lot of holes in the desert, and a lot of problems are buried in those holes. Except you gotta do it right. I mean, you gotta have the hole already dug before you show up with a package in the trunk. Otherwise you're talkin' about a half-hour or forty-five minutes of diggin'. And who knows who's gonna be comin' along in that time? Before you know it, you gotta dig a few more holes. You could be there all fuckin' night.

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: ...give him a shot at runnin' a casino and he tries to talk you out of it.

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: You know, I don't know if I could do this even if I wanted to. The Gaming Commission would never give me a license. I have at least two dozen gambling and bookmaking pinches on me.
